paper_title.ja: Multiadditive functions satisfying certain fuctional equations
paper_title.en: Multiadditive functions satisfying certain fuctional equations
On algebraic independence of a class of infinite products

description.en: Algebraic independence of values of certain infinite products is proved, where the transcendence of such numbers was already established by Tachiya. As applications explicit examples of algebraically independent numbers are also given. (C) 2016 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Arithmetical properties of certain infinite products

description.en: Tachiya investigated a class of infinite products of rational functions arithmetically and established that their values at certain algebraic points are algebraic numbers if and only if the infinite products are rational functions. In this paper we prove further arithmetical results for the values of these infinite products both qualitatively and quantitatively, which can be carried out by studying these infinite products as formal power series carefully. (C) 2015 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Exponents of Diophantine approximation and expansions in integer bases

description.en: Let xi be a real number and let b >= 2 be an integer. Let v(b)(xi) or v'(b)(xi) denote the supremum of the real numbers v for which the equation vertical bar b(n) xi vertical bar < (b(n))(-v) or vertical bar b(r) (b(s)-1) xi vertical bar < (b(r+s))(-v) has infinitely many solutions in positive integers n or r and s, respectively. Here, vertical bar center dot vertical bar stands for the distance to the nearest integer. Also let v(1) (xi) denote the supremum of the real numbers v for which the equation vertical bar q xi vertical bar < q(-v) has infinitely many solutions in positive integers q. Motivated by the question whether one can read the irrationality exponent of a real number on its b-ary expansion, we establish various results on the set of values taken by the triple of functions (v(1), v(b), v'(b)) evaluated at real points.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE LONDON MATHEMATICAL SOCIETY-SECOND SERIES

paper_title.en: Exponents of Diophantine approximation and expansions in integer bases

description.en: Let xi be a real number and let b >= 2 be an integer. Let v(b)(xi) or v'(b)(xi) denote the supremum of the real numbers v for which the equation vertical bar b(n) xi vertical bar < (b(n))(-v) or vertical bar b(r) (b(s)-1) xi vertical bar < (b(r+s))(-v) has infinitely many solutions in positive integers n or r and s, respectively. Here, vertical bar center dot vertical bar stands for the distance to the nearest integer. Also let v(1) (xi) denote the supremum of the real numbers v for which the equation vertical bar q xi vertical bar < q(-v) has infinitely many solutions in positive integers q. Motivated by the question whether one can read the irrationality exponent of a real number on its b-ary expansion, we establish various results on the set of values taken by the triple of functions (v(1), v(b), v'(b)) evaluated at real points.

paper_title.en: On Siegel-Shidlovskii's theory for q-difference equations
On integer polynomials with multiple roots
On Siegel-Shidlovskii's theory for q-difference equations
On integer polynomials with multiple roots

description.en: A new lower bound is established for the distance between two roots of an integer polynomial, and a new upper bound for the distance between a given real number and the set of zeros of an integer polynomial. The latter result is applied to improve a metrical result in Diophantine approximation.

paper_title.en: Linear independence of the values of q-hypergeometric series and related functions

description.en: We give linear independence results for the values of certain entire series and of functions satisfying certain first order q-difference equations. The former generalizes a result of Bézivin, while the latter refines that of the second named author in qualitative form. These results imply linear independence of the values of q-hypergeometric series. © 2005 Springer Science + Business Media, Inc.

paper_title.en: Linear independence of the values of q-hypergeometric series and related functions

description.en: We give linear independence results for the values of certain entire series and of functions satisfying certain first order q-difference equations. The former generalizes a result of Bezivin, while the latter refines that of the second named author in qualitative form. These results imply linear independence of the values of q-hypergeometric series.

paper_title.en: On linear independence of theta values

description.en: We prove a linear independence result for the values of theta series and Tschakaloff functions T-q(z) with different values of q.

paper_title.en: Sur la separation des racines des polynomes et une question de Sprindzuk
On linear independence of theta values

description.en: We prove a linear independence result for the values of theta series and Tschakaloff functions T-q(z) with different values of q.

paper_title.ja: Sur la separation des racines des polynomes et une question de Sprindzuk

paper_title.en: Irrationality results for values of generalized Tschakaloff series II

description.en: The study of irrationality properties of values of the generalized Tschakaloff series f (x) defined by (1.2) below was initiated by Duverney (Portugal. Math. 53(2) (1996) 229; Period. Math. Hungar. 35 (1997) 149), and continued by the authors (J. Number Theory 77 (1999) 155). The present paper proceeds to extend our previous result (Amou and Katsurada, 1999, Theorem). The irrationality of f (alpha) for any alpha epsilon Q\{0} is proved in a quantitative form under fairly general growth conditions on the coefficients off (x) (Theorem 1), while the same result is shown in a certain 'limiting' situation of Theorem 1, at the cost of loosing a quantitative aspect (Theorem 2). The linear independence of certain values of a system off (x) is also obtained (Theorem 3). The key idea in proving our previous result is a Mahler's transcendence method, due to Loxton and van der Poorten (in: A. Baker, D.W. Masser (Eds.), Transcendence Theory: Advances and Applications, Academic Press, San Diego, 1977, pp. 211-226), applied to an appropriate sequence of functions (see (2.4) and (2.5)). In order to establish Theorems 1 and 2, this method is enhanced by a certain technique which allows us to improve zero estimates for the remainder terms of Pade-type approximations (see Lemmas 3 and 4). (C) 2003 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

description.en: The study of irrationality properties of values of the generalized Tschakaloff series f (x) defined by (1.2) below was initiated by Duverney (Portugal. Math. 53(2) (1996) 229; Period. Math. Hungar. 35 (1997) 149), and continued by the authors (J. Number Theory 77 (1999) 155). The present paper proceeds to extend our previous result (Amou and Katsurada, 1999, Theorem). The irrationality of f (alpha) for any alpha epsilon Q\{0} is proved in a quantitative form under fairly general growth conditions on the coefficients off (x) (Theorem 1), while the same result is shown in a certain 'limiting' situation of Theorem 1, at the cost of loosing a quantitative aspect (Theorem 2). The key idea in proving our previous result is a Mahler's transcendence method, due to Loxton and van der Poorten (in: A. Baker, D.W. (C) 2003 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: An analogue of Shidlovskii's lemma for certain q-difference equations
An analogue of Shidlovskii's lemma for certain q-difference equations

description.en: We consider certain systems of q-difference equations of Poincaré type and give for such systems an analogue of Shidlovskii's lemma in the theory of E-functions.
